definition: visitor/(psychological counseling) client
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The visitor hammered against the door with his fists.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者用拳頭使勁地錘打着大門。

sentences.english: And I was struck, as many visitors are, by the transformation that had taken place.
sentences.chinese: 我像很多來訪者一樣，被今昔的變化所震撼。

sentences.english: The caller complained, “I’ve been sad all my life.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者控訴道，“終其一生，我都悲傷難抑。

sentences.english: When you have visitors, check them out and make sure they belong.
sentences.chinese: 有來訪者時，對他們進行檢查並確認他們的身份。

sentences.english: Visitor are always surprised to find a door with another room behind.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者總是驚異地發現一扇門後別有洞天。

sentences.english: Showing visitors around the production area must get Production Director's approval in advance.
sentences.chinese: 帶來訪者參觀生產區域須事先經生產部經理批准。

sentences.english: The visitor can ponder over the boomerangs used by aborigines at the time of Cook.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者可以琢磨琢磨土著人在庫克時期用的回飛鏢。
來訪者多得讓他應接不暇。

sentences.english: The visitor opened the wrong door and broke in on  a private conference.
sentences.chinese: 那名來訪者開錯了門，突然擾亂了一個祕密會議。

sentences.english: It can also be a symptom of envelopment or an attempt to keep visitors fatigued.
sentences.chinese: 也可能是外圍控制或企圖使來訪者疲憊的一種徵兆。

sentences.english: An anxious nation and its visitors want very much to believe him.
sentences.chinese: 一個憂患的民族和它的來訪者們極盡樂觀地去相信他。

sentences.english: The Roswell visitors were on a purely altruistic mission.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯威爾來訪者的任務純粹是利益他人的。

sentences.english: Visitors should come in or go out through the west gate.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者請徑直往小區西大門入口。

sentences.english: He stared the visitor up and down.
sentences.chinese: 他把來訪者渾身上下打量了一番。

sentences.english: She would have to efface herself before her visitor.
sentences.chinese: 她寧願避而不見來訪者。

sentences.english: Such a visitor wouldn't have been allowed into the plant unescorted.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的來訪者就不會無人陪同而被允許進入廠內。

definition: to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
idle gossip
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
waiter/waitress
equestrianism/horsemanship
to prevail upon/to coax
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
penetrating insight
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
observer
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
two-China (policy)
video program
